tweets.text: Two years after 58 lives were lost & hundreds more injured in a horrific shooting in Las Vegas, we remain committed to the fight to #EndGunViolence so other families may be spared the pain caused every day across America by the gun violence epidemic. https://t.co/RjCsC5PRoy

Four years ago, nine people lost their lives in a gun massacre at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg. Since then, countless communities across America have also suffered from gun violence, yet McConnell refuses to even allow a vote on gun safety legislation. Enough.

Today, we mourn the 58 people killed in Las Vegas two years ago in the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history.

It's shameful that the Senate has yet to pass commonsense gun reform that could save lives.

In honor of those lost, we must keep demanding action.

Two years ago, a gunman in Las Vegas took the lives of 58 people—the deadliest shooting in modern US history. 

Since then, the House has worked to pass gun reform. And Mitch McConnell has refused to do anything.

We must act to prevent history from repeating itself. #VegasStrong
